etymologies: Middle English: via Old French from Latin varius (see various)

definitions: fur, typically bluish-gray, obtained from a variety of squirrel, used in the 13th and 14th centuries as a trimming or lining for garments.
shortDefinitions: fur obtained from variety of red squirrel

definitions: fur represented by interlocking rows of shield-shaped or bell-shaped figures which are typically alternately blue and white, as a tincture.
shortDefinitions: fur represented by interlocking rows of shield-shaped or bell-shaped figures
